physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It features a man, dressed in military uniform. He is wearing a headgear, short-sleeved shirt, and mid-length pants. He is holding a stick in his right hand. Behind him, there is some thick vegetation in the background of the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.
sgcool_label_text: A variety of portraits of British soldiers that show them at leisure as well as two photographs of James Steele placing a wreath at a remembrance ceremony, this collection is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
title_text: Group of 50 photographs of P.O.W James Steele and regiment when stationed in Malaysia in 1941 (and 2 later photographs of Steele placing a wreath at ceremony of remembrance)  Gillfillan, Singapore 1941
context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
